column2: What does "rationally addicted" mean, as it seems to be an oxymoron?
Does the model consider local T21 laws? or just state level laws?
How do you quantify rational addiction to ECigs, and are different measures used for these e.g use in 30 days, as the reported figures by the youth tobacco survey?
Did you evaluate how much the implementation of T-21 increased use of combustibles instead ecigs?
Would it be possible to circulate these and other slides from the presentation after the webinar? Thanks
column5: yes, they will be available on the TOPS site next week

column2: Were you able to control for or look at the role of marijuana-related policies which may coincided with T-21?
Internet purchase: Do you distiguish between official shops and "informal" sources?
US FDA namenclature is confusing: Does "Smoking" include Vaping?
How big is the impact of probable fear of confessing a forbidden behavior? Did you control for it?
How much of the reported results could be accounted for by subsitution of ECigs for smoked tobacco, did you examine this in the paper?
What are the sample sizes for daily use of ecigs?
On the question on WHO Cares? - the evidence from this Study will be of major assitance internationally
Why do you assume that the tobacco industry is important for ecigs?
Would the 80% compliance for sale to youth allowed by the synar amedment be acceptable, or would a 'zero tolerance' policy be better
